intro: Cuphea hookeriana var. ixodes, commonly known as the crimson flame cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and compact growth habit. Cuphea hookeriana var. ixodes is relatively drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil.
